txt.en: Climb the slope and stop the Nazgûl from learning of Aragorn's passage. Rovalang must not be defeated.
Encounter Skipper Lever
Time until Nazgûl learns of Aragorn's passage
Rovalang has been defeated, and you have failed!
Rovalang must survive
Drugât emerges from the Paths of the Dead, and your mission has failed!
You have come to the foothills of the White Mountains in the company of Rovalang, searching for the terrible beast he saw flying above the Blackroot Vale.
Drugât emerges from the Paths of the Dead, and your mission has failed!
'Before we proceed, are there any companions on which you can rely? Are we on our own, or do you have a Fellowship near at hand? Speak to me again and tell me which is true!'
Rovalang has asked if you and he are on your own, or if you have a Fellowship near at hand.
'All places belong to my Master.'
'Let us leave this place, [placeholder]. The memory of such evil lies heavily upon it!'

'A cold sensation has gripped my heart, [placeholder]. Do you feel it too? I believe we draw near to the creature I beheld above the mountains!\n\n'Before we proceed, are there any companions on which you can rely? Are we on our own, or do you have a Fellowship near at hand? Speak to me again and tell me which is true!'
DNT - Blah!
'You are the ones who trespass.'
'Let us go down from here at once!'
You and Rovalang have gone to the foot of the White Mountains in search of the creature he saw.
If the Nazgûl is able to learn of Aragorn's passage, the Ranger's advantage will be lost. You must defeat the Nazgûl before he can meet with Drugât!
'I am the Bane of Rhûn; I go where I will.'
Rovalang is waiting to speak with you.
'Who are you to deny me?'
'[placeholder]?'
'You are known to us! You will not leave this place alive!'
'We will see!'
Talk to Rovalang
The Nazgûl has not yet learned of Aragorn's passage. Hope remains, for now!
'I have never before been in the presence of such evil, [placeholder]! Let us leave this place, and then we will speak of it... but not before!'
From Drugât, the Nazgûl will learn of Aragorn's passage. You have failed.
'Before we proceed, are there any companions on which you can rely? Are we on our own, or do you have a Fellowship near at hand? Speak to me again and tell me which is true!'
You have struck the Nazgûl a grievous blow: you have kept from it dangerous knowledge
You must find the Nazgûl and prevent it from learning of Aragorn's passage.
'I am glad to hear it! Now let us waste no more daylight!'
Rovalang must not be defeated
Time until the Nazgûl learns of Aragorn's passage:
Time until Nazgûl encounters Drugât:
From Drugât, the Nazgûl will learn of Aragorn's passage. You have failed.
Rovalang has fallen, and you have failed!
'We should leave this place, and at once!'
'Before we proceed, are there any companions on which you can rely? Are we on our own, or do you have a Fellowship near at hand? Speak to me again and tell me which is true!'
'We will speak when we have left this place, my friend.'
'By the King of Gondor!'
'What a terrible creature! But worse: do you see what it bears upon its back?'
Time until Nazgûl learns of Aragorn's passage
'That is a saddle, or I am a dwarf!'
'We must slip around it and find this beast's master.'
Defeat the Nazgûl before Drugât emerges from the Paths of the Dead. Rovalang must not be defeated.
Talk to Rovalang
'Careful, now....'
'A little further....'
'Halt, creature! This is no place for you!'
'We made it! Now we must hurry!'
'I am Rovalang, a Swan-knight of Dol Amroth!'
'This is [placeholder], a [placeholder] of great fame and tremendous skill!'
'And these are my friends, great heroes of renown!'
Instance: The Shadow in Morthond
Talk to Rovalang and declare your intentions
'We will drive you from this land in disgrace and defeat!'
'Very well, [placeholder]. Let us waste no more daylight!'
'Look! More maddened creatures! It must be the doing of the beast I saw...'
